title: The One With The Fake Monica

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is looking at papers.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: How could someone get a hold of your credit card number?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I have no idea. But look how much they spent!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Monica, would you calm down? The credit card people said that you only have to pay for the stuff that you bought.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know. It's just such reckless spending.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I think when someone steals your credit card, they've kind of already thrown caution to the wind.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Wow, what a geek. They spent $69.95 on a Wonder Mop.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That's me.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh! The yuk! Ross, he's doing it again! (Points to a lamp which is shaking behind the sofa)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Marcel, stop humping the lamp! Stop humping! Now Marcel, come back- (Marcel runs toward Rachel's room) come here, Marcel-

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh no, not in my room! I'll get him.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ross, you've got to do something about the humping.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What? It's, it's just a phase.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, that's what we said about Joey...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Would you all relax? It's not that big a deal.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (Out of shot) Stop it! Marcel! Bad monkey!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Let's just say my Curious George doll is no longer curious.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is looking at papers.]

events.event_description: Monica expresses frustration over the reckless spending on her credit card.
Chandler jokes about Monica's $69.95 purchase on a Wonder Mop.
Phoebe points out that Ross's monkey, Marcel, is humping a lamp.
Ross attempts to stop Marcel from humping the lamp.
Marcel runs towards Rachel's room.
Rachel confronts Marcel in her room, ruining her Curious George doll.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, late at night Monica is still examining her bill as Rachel
emerges from her room.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, Monica. You are not still going over that thing.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: This woman's living my life.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: She's living my life, and she's doing it better than me! Look at this, look. She buys tickets for plays that I wanna see. She, she buys clothes from stores that I'm intimidated by the sales people. She spent three hundred dollars on art supplies.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You're not an artist.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, well I might be if I had the supplies! I mean, I could do all this stuff. Only I don't.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, Monica, c'mon, you do cool things.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh really? Okay, let's compare, shall we.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (Yawning) Oh, it's so late for 'Shall we'...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Do I go horseback riding in the park? Do I take classes at the New School?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (Yawning) Nooo...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: This is so unfair! She's got everything I want, and she doesn't have my mother.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, late at night Monica is still examining her bill as Rachel
emerges from her room.]

events.event_description: Monica expresses frustration about another woman's life.
Rachel questions Monica's frustration.
Monica compares her life to the woman's, mentioning specific actions.
Rachel yawns and responds to Monica's comparisons.
Monica questions Rachel's perception of her activities.
Rachel confirms Monica's lack of those activities.
Monica expresses frustration over the unfairness of the situation.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Joey and Chandler are discussing stage names.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: How about Joey... Pepponi?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, still too ethnic. My agent thinks I should have a name that's more neutral.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Joey... Switzerland?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Plus, y'know, I think it should be Joe. Y'know, Joey makes me sound like I'm, I dunno, this big. (Waitress looks at him funny) Which I'm not.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Joe...Joe...Joe...Stalin?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Stalin...Stalin...do I know that name? It sounds familiar.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, it does not ring a bell with me...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (Writes it down) Joe Stalin. Y'know, that's pretty good.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Might wanna try Joseph.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Joseph Stalin. I think you'd remember that!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh yes! Bye Bye Birdie, starring Joseph Stalin. Joseph Stalin is the Fiddler on the Roof.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Joey and Chandler are discussing stage names.]

events.event_description: Chandler suggests the stage name "Joey Pepponi" to Joey.
Joey objects to "Joey Pepponi" and explains his agent prefers a more neutral name.
Chandler suggests the stage name "Joey Switzerland" to Joey.
Joey clarifies that he prefers his name to be shorter and less ethnic, mentioning Joey makes him sound too big.
Chandler jokes about the name "Joe Stalin" as a potential stage name for Joey.
Joey writes down "Joe Stalin" after finding the name intriguing.
Chandler suggests the name "Joseph" as a more refined option.
Joey counters with "Joseph Stalin," thinking it sounds memorable.
Chandler humorously references "Bye Bye Birdie" and "Fiddler on the Roof," suggesting Joseph Stalin's involvement in those shows.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is there as Phoebe and Rachel enter.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi. (On the phone) Hi, uh, yes, this is Monica Geller. Um, I believe I'm taking some classes with you and I was wondering what they were.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (Hushes her) Alright, great. Thanks a lot. (Hangs up) I'm going to tap class.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What, what, so that you can dance with the woman that stole your credit card?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: This woman's got my life, I should get to see who she is.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Go to the post office! I'm sure her picture's up! ...Okay, Monica, y'know what, honey, you're kinda losing it here! I mean, this is really becoming like a weird obsession thing.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: This is madness. It's madness, I tell you, for the love of God, Monica, don't do it !! ...Thank you.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is there as Phoebe and Rachel enter.]

events.event_description: Monica makes a phone call to inquire about her tap classes.
Rachel questions Monica's decision to attend tap class.
Monica explains her reason for attending tap class to Rachel.
Rachel suggests Monica go to the post office instead.
Rachel expresses concern about Monica's obsession.
Phoebe begs Monica not to pursue her tap class idea.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A Tap Class, the girls are standing at the door.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What d'you think?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Lotsa things.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Which one do you think she is?

dialogue.speaker: TEACHER
dialogue.text: May I help you?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, no thanks, we're just here to observe.

dialogue.speaker: TEACHER
dialogue.text: You don't observe a dance class. You dance

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What does she mean?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I think she means (Imitates) 'You dance

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, d'y'see anybody you think could be me?

dialogue.speaker: TEACHER
dialogue.text: (To the class) People! Last time there were some empty yoghurt containers lying around after class. Let's not have that happen again!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: She could be you.

dialogue.speaker: TEACHER
dialogue.text: Let's get started. Five, six, a-five six seven eight...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, I'm not getting this!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (Dancing in a swirly, Phoebe kind of way) I'm totally getting it!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Did you ever feel like sometimes you are just so unbelievably uncoordinated?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What? You just click when they click.

dialogue.speaker: TEACHER
dialogue.text: Alright people, now everyone grab a partner.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay. And, my, dead, mother, says, you, are, it. I'm with Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Great. It's gym class all over again.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE AND RACHEL
dialogue.text: Aww.

dialogue.speaker: TEACHER
dialogue.text: Well that's all right, you can come up to the front and dance with me.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why don't I just take off my clothes and have a nightmare.

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: It's okay, it's okay, I'm here, I'm here. Sorry I'm late, okay, here I am. Who's the new tense girl?

dialogue.speaker: TEACHER
dialogue.text: She's your partner.

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: Hi. I'm Monica.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh. Monica! ...Hi. I'm Mo- ...nana.

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: (Fake Monica) Monana?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah. It's Dutch.

dialogue.speaker: FAKE MONICA
dialogue.text: You're kidding! I-I spent three years in Amsterdam. (Asks her something in Dutch)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Um, Pennsylvania Dutch.

dialogue.speaker: TEACHER
dialogue.text: And we're dancing. A-five, six, seven, eight...

scenes.event_description: [Scene: A Tap Class, the girls are standing at the door.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (Mortified) Hi.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER AND JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Where've you been?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: At the vet.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: She's not gonna make you wear one of those big plastic cones, is she?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: She says Marcel's humping thing's not a phase. Apparently he's reached sexual maturity.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (To Chandler) Hey! He beat ya.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: She says as time goes on, he's gonna start getting agressive and violent.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So what does this mean?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm gonna have to give him up.

events.event_description: Ross enters Central Perk.
Ross responds to Joey's question about his whereabouts.
Chandler jokes about Marcel wearing a plastic cone.
Ross reveals Marcel has reached sexual maturity.
Joey teases Chandler about Marcel beating him.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, scene continued from earlier.  They guys are sitting there
like the Three Monkeys.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I can't believe it, Ross. This sucks!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I don't get it, I mean, you just got him. How can he be an adult already?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I know. I know. I mean, one day, he's this little thing, and before you know it, he's this little thing I can't get off my leg.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Isn't there any way you can keep him?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no. The vet says unless he's in a place where he has regular access to some... monkey lovin,' he's just gonna get vicious. I've just gotta get him into a zoo.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: How do you get a monkey into a zoo?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I know that one! ...No, that's Popes into a Volkswagen .

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, we're applying to a lot of them. Naturally our first choice would be one of the bigger state zoos, y'know, like, uh, San Diego... right? But that might just be a pipe dream, because, y'know, he's out of state. Uh, my vet, uh, knows someone at Miami, so that's a possibility.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, but that's like two blocks away from the beach. I mean, it's a total party zoo.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey. We found her, we found the girl.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Did you call the cops?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Nope. We took her to lunch.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ah. Your own brand of vigilante justice.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?! Are you insane? This woman stole from you. She stole. She's a stealer.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Y'know what? After you're with this woman for like ten minutes, you forget all that. I mean, she is this astounding person, with this, with this amazing spirit.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, which she probably stole from some cheerleader.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ...Take off their hats!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Popes in a Volkswagen ! ...I love that joke.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, scene continued from earlier.  They guys are sitting there
like the Three Monkeys.]

events.event_description: Ross expresses frustration about his monkey growing up too quickly.
Ross discusses potential zoos for his monkey, mentioning San Diego and Miami.
Phoebe announces they found the woman who stole from Rachel.
Rachel explains they took the thief to lunch instead of calling the cops.
Ross and Monica argue about the woman's character.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Rachel and Fake Monica are there.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No way. No way did you do this.

dialogue.speaker: FAKE MONICA
dialogue.text: Monana was very brave.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It was so wild. We told them we were the Gunnersens in room six fifteen. Only to find out the Boston Celtics had taken over the entire sixth floor!

dialogue.speaker: FAKE MONICA
dialogue.text: So once they caught on to the fact that we're, y'know, short and have breasts...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: ...They threw us out! I was thrown out of a hotel! Me!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Go Monana! Well, you ladies are not the only ones living the dream. I get to go pour coffee for people I don't know. Don't wait up. (Exits)

dialogue.speaker: FAKE MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, by the way, tomorrow we're auditioning for a Broadway show.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: 'Scuse me?

dialogue.speaker: FAKE MONICA
dialogue.text: There's an open call for Cats. I'm thinking we go down there, sing Memories and make complete fools of ourselves. Whaddya say?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Nononononono. Think who you're dealing with here. I mean, I'm not like you. I-I can't even stand in front of a tap class.

dialogue.speaker: FAKE MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, that's just probably 'cause of your Amish background.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: FAKE MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, you're Pennsylvania Dutch, right?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Right. Till I bought a blow dryer, then I was shunned.

dialogue.speaker: FAKE MONICA
dialogue.text: I-I used to be just like you. And then one day I saw a movie that changed my life. Did you ever see Dead Poets' Society ?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Uh-huh.

dialogue.speaker: FAKE MONICA
dialogue.text: I thought that movie was so incredibly... boring . I mean, that thing at the end where the kid kills himself because he can't be in the play? What was that?! It's like, kid, wait a year, leave home, do some community theatre. I walked out of there and I thought, 'Now, that's two hours of my life that I'm never getting back.' And that thought scared me more than all the other crap I was afraid to do.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wow. Then I would definitely not recommend Mrs. Doubtfire .

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Rachel and Fake Monica are there.]

events.event_description: Rachel expresses disbelief upon hearing Fake Monica's statement about Monana's bravery.
Fake Monica refers to Monica as 'Monana' and mentions her bravery.
Monica recounts their hotel incident, mentioning the Gunnersens and Boston Celtics.
Fake Monica explains that their physical traits led to being thrown out of the hotel.
Monica expresses her shock at being thrown out of the hotel.
Rachel exits to pour coffee for people she doesn't know.
Fake Monica mentions auditioning for a Broadway show, specifically Cats.
Monica refuses to audition for Cats, citing her fear of performing.
Fake Monica teases Monica about her Amish background and the blow dryer incident.
Monica reacts to Fake Monica's teasing about her Amish background.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, tiem lapse.  Everyone but Joey and Monica are there.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (Reading letters) Oh God. (To Marcel) We didn't get into Scranton. (To the others) That was like our safety zoo. They take like dogs and cows. See? I don't know who this is harder on, me or him.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I'd say that chair's taking the brunt.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Marcel! Marcel! Marcel, no! Good boy. See, how can nobody want him?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, somebody will.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (entering) You know there already is a Joseph Stalin?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You're kidding.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Apparently he was this Russian dictator who slaughtered all these people. You'd think you would've known that!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know, you'd think I would've.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Phoebe. Whaddyou think a good stage name for me would be?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: ...Flame Boy.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, tiem lapse.  Everyone but Joey and Monica are there.]

events.event_description: Ross expresses frustration about not getting into Scranton and comforts Marcel.
Phoebe makes a light joke about the chair taking the brunt of Ross's frustration.
Ross comforts Marcel, showing affection and frustration.
Rachel offers encouragement, believing someone will take Marcel.
Joey enters and makes a joke about Joseph Stalin, surprising the group.
Chandler reacts with disbelief to Joey's joke about Stalin.
Joey asks Phoebe for a stage name, seeking creative advice.
Phoebe humorously suggests 'Flame Boy' as Joey's stage name.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Ross is talking to Dr. Baldhara, a zookeeper.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Where exactly is your zoo?

dialogue.speaker: DR. BALDHARA
dialogue.text: Well, it's technically not a zoo per se, it's more of an interactive wildlife experience. Let me ask you some questions about, is it, uh, Marcel?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: DR. BALDHARA
dialogue.text: Does he, uh, fight with other animals?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No-no, he's, he's very docile.

dialogue.speaker: DR. BALDHARA
dialogue.text: Even if he were... cornered?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well I, I don't know. Why?

dialogue.speaker: DR. BALDHARA
dialogue.text: Uh, how is he at handling small objects?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: He can hold a banana, if that's whatcha mean...

dialogue.speaker: DR. BALDHARA
dialogue.text: How about a hammer, or a small blade?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Why- why- why would he need a blade?

dialogue.speaker: DR. BALDHARA
dialogue.text: Well, if he's up against a jungle cat or an animal with horns, you've got to give the little guy something. Otherwise it's just cruel.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER AND JOEY
dialogue.text: He- he- he got in, he- he got in to San Diego.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: We, we come back from our walk and the- the phone was ringing...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ...He's in.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: He's in! Oh, did you hear that, Marcel? San Diego. San Diego!

dialogue.speaker: DR. BALDHARA
dialogue.text: You're making a big mistake here. I mean, San Diego's all well and good, but if you give him to me, I'll start him off against a blind rabbit and give you twenty percent of the gains.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Ross is talking to Dr. Baldhara, a zookeeper.]

events.event_description: Ross answers Dr. Baldhara's questions about Marcel's behavior.
Dr. Baldhara suggests giving Marcel a weapon against jungle cats.
Chandler and Joey announce Marcel's entry into San Diego.
Ross reacts excitedly to Marcel being in San Diego.
Dr. Baldhara warns against sending Marcel to San Diego.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is dusting. She comes to the table, lifts all the
magazines and wipes under them, then just puts them down again. Monica bursts in,
obviously drunk.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yo- hooo!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Where the hell've you been?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Monica and I just crashed an embassy party.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Are you drunk?!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Noooo! (Comes closer and whispers) I'm lying. I am so drunk.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh God, oh. Great, Monica, y'know what, you could've called, I have been up here, I've been worried...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Monica? Monica!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Water rules!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, it does. Okay, look, the restaurant called, they wanna know if you're gonna be showing up for work?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Nope. Going to the Big Apple Circus today.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay Monica, what are you doing? You're gonna lose your job! This is not you!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, it is me! Y'know, I'm not just the person who needs to fluff the pillows and pay the bills as soon as they come in! Y'know, when I'm with her, I am so much more than that. I'm- I'm Monana!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hello? Yes, she is, hold on a second, please. Monana, it's for you, the credit card people.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Helloooo? Yeah. Oh my God. Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: They've arrested Monica.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is dusting. She comes to the table, lifts all the
magazines and wipes under them, then just puts them down again. Monica bursts in,
obviously drunk.]

events.event_description: Monica bursts into the apartment, clearly drunk.
Rachel confronts Monica about her disappearance.
Monica admits she is drunk.
Rachel expresses worry about Monica's absence and mentions she could have called.
Rachel informs Monica that the restaurant called about her job.
Monica decides not to go to work and mentions going to the Big Apple Circus.
Monica claims she is 'Monana' and expresses frustration about her job.
Rachel pretends to take a phone call to get Monica's attention.
Monica reacts to the pretend call, stating 'They've arrested Monica.'

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: New York City Department of Correction, Monica is visiting Fake Monica.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: FAKE MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How are you?

dialogue.speaker: FAKE MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm not too bad. Fortunately, blue's my colour. How-how did you know I was here?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Because... I'm Monica Geller. It was my credit card you were using.

dialogue.speaker: FAKE MONICA
dialogue.text: That I was not expecting.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I want you to know, it wasn't me who turned you in.

dialogue.speaker: FAKE MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh. Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, thank you! You have given me so much! I mean, if it wasn't for you, I would never have gotten to sing Memories on the stage at the Wintergarden Theater !

dialogue.speaker: FAKE MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, actually, you only got to sing 'Memo-'.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I just can't believe you're in here. I mean, what am I gonna do without you? Who's gonna crash the embassy parties with me? Who's gonna take me to the Big Apple Circus ?

dialogue.speaker: FAKE MONICA
dialogue.text: Monica, I started my day by peeing in front of twenty-five other women, and you're worried about who's gonna take you to the Big Apple Circus ?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, not... worried, just... wondering.

dialogue.speaker: FAKE MONICA
dialogue.text: There's nothing to wonder about, Monica. You're gonna go back to being exactly who you were, because that's who you are.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Not necessarily...

dialogue.speaker: FAKE MONICA
dialogue.text: Yes necessarily! I mean, I dunno what it is, maybe it's the Amish thing.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Um, I'm not actually Amish.

dialogue.speaker: FAKE MONICA
dialogue.text: Really? Then why are you like that?

scenes.location: New York City Department of Correction
scenes.event_description: [Scene: New York City Department of Correction, Monica is visiting Fake Monica.]

events.event_description: Monica greets Fake Monica.
events.location: New York City Department of Correction

events.event_description: Monica reveals that Fake Monica was using her credit card.
events.location: New York City Department of Correction

events.event_description: Fake Monica expresses surprise at Monica's knowledge.
events.location: New York City Department of Correction

events.event_description: Monica clarifies that she did not turn Fake Monica in.
events.location: New York City Department of Correction

events.event_description: Fake Monica thanks Monica for not turning her in.
events.location: New York City Department of Correction

events.event_description: Monica expresses gratitude to Fake Monica for helping her sing 'Memories'.
events.location: New York City Department of Correction

events.event_description: Fake Monica corrects Monica, stating she only sang 'Memo-' of 'Memories'.
events.location: New York City Department of Correction

events.event_description: Monica expresses concern about who will take her to events without Fake Monica.
events.location: New York City Department of Correction

events.event_description: Fake Monica dismisses Monica's concerns, mentioning her own day's activities.
events.location: New York City Department of Correction

events.event_description: Fake Monica questions Monica's personality and behavior.
events.location: New York City Department of Correction

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Tap Class, Monica is standing by the door.]

dialogue.speaker: TEACHER
dialogue.text: You by the door. In or out?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: In. (She joins in the dancing. She still flounders)

dialogue.speaker: TEACHER
dialogue.text: You in the back, you're getting it all wrong!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, but at least I'm doing it!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Tap Class, Monica is standing by the door.]

events.event_description: Monica moves from the door into the class to join the dancing.
The teacher corrects Monica's dancing, pointing out she's doing it wrong.
Monica defends her dancing, arguing that at least she's participating despite her mistakes.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Airport, everyone but Monica is there to see off Marcel.]

dialogue.speaker: PA
dialogue.text: This is the final boarding call for flight 67 to San Diego, boarding at gate 42A.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay. Good-bye, little monkey guy. Alright, I wrote you this poem. Okay, but don't eat it 'till you get on the plane.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Aww. Thank you, Aunt Phoebe.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, bye, champ. Now, I know there's gonna be a lot of babes in San Diego, but remember, there's also a lot to learn.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I dunno what to say, Ross. Uh, it's a monkey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Just, just say what you feel.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Marcel, I'm hungry.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That was good.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (Brings Marcel a teddy bear) Marcel, this is for you. It's, uh, just, y'know, something to, um, do on the plane.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh, if you guys don't mind, I'd like to take a moment, just me and him.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh, sure. Sure, absolutely. (They just stand there, then realise what he means and go to the other end of the room)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Marcel, c'mere, c'mere. (He sits down and Marcel jumps down and sits beside him) Well buddy, this is it. There's just a coupla things I want to say. I'm really gonna miss you, and I'm never gonna forget about you. You've been more than just a pet to me, you've been more like a be- (Marcel climbs down and starts humping his leg) Okay, Marcel, please, could you leave my leg alone? Could you just stop humping me for two seconds?! Marcel, would- okay, just take him away. Just take him.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The Airport, everyone but Monica is there to see off Marcel.]

events.event_description: The PA announces the final boarding call for flight 67 to San Diego.
Phoebe says goodbye to Marcel and gives him a poem.
Ross thanks Phoebe for the poem.
Chandler says goodbye to Marcel and gives him advice about San Diego.
Rachel gives Marcel a teddy bear.
Ross asks everyone to give him a moment alone with Marcel.
Marcel starts humping Ross's leg.
Ross asks someone to take Marcel away.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A Theater, there is a casting session going on for a play.]

dialogue.speaker: ACTOR
dialogue.text: (Very melodramatically, and very badly) Oh, that I were a glove upon that hand, that I might... touch thy cheek...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hi, uh, I'll be reading for the role of Mercutio.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Holden McGroin.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: A Theater, there is a casting session going on for a play.]

events.event_description: ACTOR performs a poorly delivered monologue from Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet.
JOEY introduces himself as a candidate for the role of Mercutio.
JOEY provides his name, Holden McGroin, as he prepares to read for the role.
